quote: Can't you ever just... let go?
Let go?

The place is almost deserted... there    hasn't been a ship in for three    days... and yet you just sit here    like a Baneriam Hawk looking for    prey.  This is your chance to relax.       I could fix you up with a terrific    holosuite program.
Thank you, but I don't accept gifts    from the likes of you.
Who said anything about gifts?  You    pay like anyone else.  I'm just trying    to get you into the tent.
I have no time for fantasies.
Ah.  No imagination, huh?
Waste of time.  Too many people dream    of places they'll never go, wish for    things they'll never have... instead    of paying adequate attention to their    real lives...
I could create a shape-shifter    playmate for you... the two of you    could... intermingle...
You're disgusting.
It's a living.
You're not allowing young Mister    Sisko in your holosuites, I hope...
It's not what you think...
It better not be.

You see that thing on his hand... ?     It's a baseball mitten.  Every    afternoon, the boy goes up to play.     His father brought a program with    famous players... you ever hear of    Tris Speaker or Ted Williams or Buck    Bokai?
Afraid not.
Neither had I until I made it my    business to find out.  With all these    humans coming now... a true    entrepreneur knows how to sniff the    wind...
Try it.  Go ahead...
I have no sense of smell.
You don't need one to detect the    scent of op-por-tun-itee.
Opportunity.

Family entertainment.  That's the    future, Odo.  There's a fortune to    be made.  Little holo-creatures    running around... rides and games    for the kiddies... Ferengis at every    doorway selling useless souvenirs...
You're replacing all your sexual    holo-programs with family    entertainment...
No, no, no, no, no... I'm expanding...    I'm negotiating to lease the space    next door so I can use the same holo-   generators...
You're still disgusting.
Till the day I die.
I'm sure you're exaggerating...
You're constantly in my thoughts...    I can't concentrate...
You seemed to be concentrating just    fine on that junior lieutenant at    the reception for Captain Stadius...
She was a poor substitute for you...
And that Betazoid envoy who was here    last week...
A... barely adequate substitute for    you...
Julian, you're a wonderful friend.
(pained at the sound     of that)   Argh.
I enjoy the time we spend together.
Stop... you're driving a stake through    my heart.
Try a high-pitched sonic shower.     It'll make you feel better.
No it won't.       I've already tried it.
Sorry I'm late.  I was having dinner    with Julian.
How is our young doctor?
Young.       Anything going on?
We were just looking at an unusual    energy reading...
Elevated thoron emissions in the    plasma field...
We thought it might be an    environmental byproduct created by    the increased traffic to this area...

Could be.  Ships have always avoided    the Denorios Belt... we have no idea    how the presence of so many warp and    impulse engines might affect it.     Question is -- is this going to cause    us any problems?
We were hoping you'd tell us.

... and the messenger from the Queen    watched the little man as he danced    and sang and laughed how he would    soon have the daughter he always    wanted... because they would never    guess that his name was...
...Rumpelstiltskin...

... Rumpelstiltskin, right... and the    next day when the little man came    and asked, "Now Mrs. Queen, what is    my name?"  She said at first, "Are    you called Jack?" "No," he answered.     "Are you called Harry?" she asked    again.  "No," he answered.  And then    she said, "Then perhaps your name    is... "
Rumpelstiltskin...

And at the sound of his own name,    the old man was so furious that he    stamped his foot into the ground    shaking the entire kingdom, broke in    two and disappeared and the King and    Queen and their daughter lived happily    ever after.       Good night, little one.  Sweet dreams.
I'm not tired!
Uh uh, none of that now.
Now then, should I tuck you in with    a bedtime story too... ?
As long as you're tucked in with me.
Mommy...
What is it, honey?
He's in my room.
Who?
Rumpelstiltskin.
Sweetheart, that was just a make    believe story.  Rumpelstiltskin isn't    real, okay?
All right.  I'll come in and check.     But after that, it's bedtime.
I don't know why we tell her stories    about evil dwarfs who want to steal    children...
Don't look so distraught.  I'm only    here to offer you my services... if    you should need them.
Take her outside.
What's wrong?
Miles...
Just go.
A pity you're sending the ladies    away.  It's as if all the life just    went out of the room.
O'Brien to Security... intruder    alert... send a team to my quarters    immediately.
So where's the straw... ?    (off O'Brien's non-    phased look)   I assume you need some gold spun out    of straw...
What are you?
Surely you know -- you were just    telling the little one all about    me...
I know what you look like... but    you're not...
Ah ah, don't say it... I don't like    the sound of it you know...
Rumpelstiltskin.

You didn't think that would make me    break in two and disappear, did you?    (O'Brien looks at him     evenly)   Not this time.  I learned my lesson    back in the kingdom.  I don't make    deals like that any more.
Ah, the local constabularies...       Gents, give me a small bit of courtesy    and I'll be very pleasant, but if    you try to lay a hand on me, you'll    soon regret it.
Besides, I'm much too fast for you.     Now, my good host, if gold is not    your pleasure, tell me your needs    and I'll tell you my price...
O'Brien to Sisko.
Go ahead, Chief.
I need you down in my quarters...
... On the double.
I'm on my way.
Dad, I've got to talk to you...
I don't have time, Jake, I...
Hello, Ben.
He followed me home from the    holosuite.
Jadzia!
Hello, Julian.
What are you doing here?
Watching you... waiting for you to    wake up.
I'm awake.
Is something wrong?
Funny, I was just going to ask you    the same question.
A Larosian virus has been going    around.       How do you feel?
(moving in for another     kiss)   Wonderful.
No fever...    (points the tricorder     at himself)   It must be me... some kind of allergic    reaction to the replicated antipasto    from lunch perhaps... I must be    hallucinating...
Why are you fighting this?
Why am I fighting this?  Why am I    fighting this... I have no good answer    to that question...
All senior officers... report to Ops    immediately.
Okay, I get it.  Very funny.  Did    O'Brien put you up to it?
I don't know what you're talking    about.
"Senior officers report to Ops"...    we walk in, everyone has a good laugh    at my expense...
This is not a joke, Julian...
We'll see...

It seems we have a small mystery on    our hands... Lieutenant Jadzia Dax,    Doctor Julian Bashir... I'd like you    to meet Harmon Bokai, a baseball    player for the London Kings who's    been dead for two hundred years...
Don't look at me -- I can't figure    it out either...
And a medieval fairy tale character    named Rumpelstiltskin...
Oh fine, now everyone knows my name...
Until today, he's only existed in    storybooks.
A pleasure... I'm sure.
Could this be related to the increased    thoron emissions in the plasma field?
Thoron emissions?
I think you'd better ask me,    Benjamin...

I was hitting a few to the boy...    he's really been moving under the    ball well lately, Ben... and we    would've worked on some baserunning    except he was getting hungry... and    then I realized I was too...
A hologram with an appetite?
Hologram?
On the contrary, Major, he's quite    real.  They all seem to be.
What the hell are they talking about,    Ben?
You... you're not actually Buck Bokai.
Then how come I'm wearing his uniform?
You're a holographic image of Buck    Bokai that I created so Jake and I    could play ball with you...

But I remember.  I remember all the    games, all the opening days, the    home run that won the forty-two world    series... the squeaker that went    under Eddie Newsom's glove the day I    broke Dimaggio's consecutive streak...
I programmed it into the computer...    all of it... every statistic.
What foreign tongue are they    speaking... ?
This one didn't come out of any    holosuite...
But he did come out of your    imagination just like Buck came out    of Jake's...
His imagination?
Then I must have come out of your    imagination, Julian...
Not necessarily... well, maybe...
... How could this sort of thing    possibly happen... ?
A subspace disruption maybe, some    kind of dimensional shift...
I didn't see an anomaly when I scanned    the plasma field... but it could    have been so small that the sensors    missed it...
Julian, let's go to your quarters...
Please... I don't have time for...
... this?
Odo to Sisko.
Go ahead...
Is there something you want to tell    me?
I'm in no mood for games, Constable.     What do you need?
Have the environmental controls broken    down?  It's snowing on the Promenade.
Snowing...
We're looking at five or six    centimeters down here.
Bring in all available security,    Odo... we're going to yellow alert...
What's going on...
It seems we're letting our    imaginations run wild.  I'll give    you an explanation as soon as I have    one... Sisko out...
Yellow alert against our own    imaginations?
You have a better idea?
The baseball player.  He's gone now,    too.
I think I've got something... look    at the wave patterns of the plasma    field...
The wave fronts are converging toward    a single point...
The particle density rises as you    get closer to the center... but then    it looks like it drops off    completely...
You're right.  I'm not picking up    any particulate readings at the    core...
What does that mean?
Whatever falls in there... is just    gone.
Then you were right... it is some    kind of subspace disruption...
I want a full analysis... Chief, get    a class four probe ready...
Aye, sir...
Anything I can do to help?
Odo to Ops...
Go ahead...
The snow's disappeared... but now    there's a Gunji jackdaw running loose    down here...
Just try to keep things under control,    Odo... we're working on it...
Understood...
Dabo!  Come on... eight straight    passes.  Double down dabo... I can't    lose today... throw them again...    come on... come on... one more dabo    for daddy...
Ladies and gentlemen... and all    androgynous species... may I have    your attention, please... Your    attention please!
As you may have noticed, we're    experiencing some... difficulties...    I'm going to have to ask you all to    please refrain from using your    imaginations...
Just because you don't have an    imagination, don't ruin it for the    rest of us...
Let me guess.  Another clever    Federation experiment has gone awry    and you accidently turned the whole    station into one vast holosuite...
The phenomenon is being investigated    as we speak.
Well, tell them to take their time...    I haven't had the chance to show the    ladies my collection of Tartaran    landscapes yet...
I'm surprised by your attitude,    Quark...
You simply don't have the same    appreciation for... art as I do...
I'm surprised because every one of    your customers is winning...
What?
They're taking you to the poor-   house...
Dabo... another winner...
No... no... that's not possible...
Lose... lose... one cross... two    cross...
Dabo!  Another winner!
No!
You're outnumbered, Quark.
Pardon me.
I was afraid of this... The proximity    of the wormhole is amplifying the    rupture...
The proton counts are going through    the roof...
Dax to O'Brien.  How are you coming    with that probe, Chief?
I'll have the subspace scanners    programmed in less than an hour...
Keep me informed... Dax out.
I have the wave intensity analysis...
Computer, scan all data files for    comparable wave intensity patterns...
Stand by.
Jadzia, this is difficult to say,    but I want you to know...
Julian, there's really no need to    apologize...
In a way, I feel as if we've invaded    your privacy.  We all have fantasies    and dreams that we keep to ourselves.     Thoughts that should remain private.
I'm glad you understand.
Of course I do.  I was a young man    once.
Then we can put it behind us?
Of course.
Good.       The computer seems to be having    trouble finding a match...
She really is submissive, isn't she...
Is that how you'd like me to be,    Julian?  So... submissive?
I am not submissive...       ... am I?
N-no, I don't think so...
I'm just not the cold fish you are...
Cold fish...
Now, I never said that...
If you'd get down off your high horse,    you'd start to appreciate Julian...
(trying hard to make     light of all this)   She has a sense of humor as... as    I've always imagined you do...
I could use one about now...
Come on, Lieutenant... stop denying    all those yearnings you feel...
Yearnings.
(as she cozies up to     the humiliated Bashir)   If you don't, you'll never know what    you missed.
Pattern match found.
Just in the nick of time.
Not quite.
A similar subspace rupture was    reported in the Hanoli System in the    mid twenty-third century...
Hanoli system... I don't believe I    know where that is...
There's no reason you should.
When that rupture exploded, the system    was destroyed...

Station log, Stardate 46853.2.  We    have launched a probe to study the    subspace anomaly.  Meanwhile, more    than half the people aboard DS Nine    have reported manifestations of their    imagined thoughts.
All probe systems are reading    normal...
Calibrating sensors for subspace...    Three minutes to coordinates...
Wave patterns should begin to    fluctuate any time now... there...
Probe is penetrating the thoron    field... two and a half minutes to    coordinates...
Ah, for simpler times, eh?
Shoo!
I only want to help.
You're in the way.
A farmer in Chester once tried to    chase me off until I saved his crops    from locusts...
Two minutes to coordinates... thoron    emissions are stable...
You know what I find most intriguing    about you, my good host?       You're afraid... of me.
Look, you figment... I don't fear    any man... least of all you...       Ninety seconds to coordinates...
A figment, am I...
Just a figment of my imagination,    that's all.
And yet you can't deny how this    imagination of yours empowers me,    can you?  Empowers me in a way that    somehow terrifies you...
You should be getting some preliminary    data, Commander...
They're coming in now, Chief... stand-   by...
She is your first born, isn't she?
Thirty seconds to coordinates...
Thoron emission patterns unstable...    probe hull temperature dropping    rapidly...
Ten seconds...
What is it...
Negative readings on all sensors...    we may be looking at some sort of    folded space...
Let's see what the optical scanner    on the probe gives us...
It's drawing in all the matter from    the surrounding space...
Benjamin, it's getting larger.
Feel like taking a few ground balls?

Look, I tried to tell you... you're    on a space station... in the twenty-   fourth century... the only ball field    around is a holographic simulation --    it's not real... and neither are    you...
See, I don't get it... I can pinch    myself and it hurts... I am here    with you, aren't I... ?
Right now you are... in a minute,    who knows?       I'm hoping when we get this thing    figured out... you'll...
Disappear for good?
I hope so...

(almost sorry, doesn't     quite buy it)   You do, huh.       Okay, but let's say for a moment I    don't.  What am I supposed to do    then?  You got room on your team for    a switch hitting third baseman with    good power... ?
Good power from the left side.
What are you talking about.  I hit    over twenty homers righthanded in    each of my first three years in the    majors...
And never more than ten after that...
That was only after Old Crow moved    me to second in the order...
I wish I had more time for this.
Yeah, well that was baseball's    epitaph, wasn't it... nobody seemed    to have time for us anymore... I    could've played five more years if    they hadn't killed the game...
You were the best that ever played,    Buck... I know -- I've played with    them all.
I've got work to do.
Yeah.  Hey, Ben.       It's always meant a lot to me.  How    much you cared.  You know the day we    won that world series, there were    only three hundred people in the    stands.
Three hundred and one in my version.
I heard you cheering.  It meant a    lot to me.  I just thought you should    know.  You know, in case I do finally    disappear.
Ops...
We don't know any more than when we    started.
Why would mine create a woman and    then reject her?
Why would mine create a dwarf who    could terrify him?  We should abandon    the whole thing.
Not yet.  I've made a connection    with mine.  A curious one.  I sensed    a feeling from him... an affection    for this ballplayer who died two    hundred years before he was even    born.
How much longer do you suggest we    devote to this?
As long as it takes.       It ain't over til it's over.
A Vulcan science mission to the Hanoli    rift detonated a pulse wave torpedo    at the coordinates of the tear...
Five minutes after they did, the    rupture expanded radically...
They were wiped out along with the    entire Hanoli system...
What happened to the rupture after    that... it's not still there... ?
It reached a critical mass point and    imploded... and then disappeared    from normal space altogether.
Were there any reports from the    Vulcans about hallucinations on board?     Anything similar to what we're    experiencing?
Nossir.  But they were only within    range of the anomaly for twelve    hours...
And Vulcans don't have the most active    imaginations...
Were there any explanations offered    for the initial cause of the rupture?
Dozens.  Nothing confirmed.  But we    do know there were no wormholes and    very little starship activity in the    area before it formed.

We've looked high and low for some    common ground... something to give    us a fix on how to attack this    thing... frankly, sir, as funny as    it sounds, we think pulse wave    torpedoes may still be the best    approach...
Wait a minute... it didn't work very    well last time... why...

The Vulcans were using a primitive    device... in two hundred years, we've    developed far better ways of    controlling the flux density... we    might be able to contain the internal    reaction this time...
And if we can't, we'll destroy the    whole Bajoran system...
Major, the rupture is already    expanding... we have to seal it or    it's going to destroy this system    anyway...
The smaller it is, the better chance    we have.
How long will it take to create one    of these torpedoes?
We could have one ready by twenty-   two hundred hours...

If the rift expands at all before    imploding, we have to be prepared...    route auxiliary power to shields...    Major, I'd like you to coordinate    evacuation of the pylons.  Odo can    help you.  Dismissed.
Lower pylon one.
Kira to Odo.
What is it, Major?
(reacts curiously to     the noise)   I need you to do a security sweep    through the pylons... we're going to    evacuate them...
I'll get on it as soon as possible...    I've got my hands full right now...    clear the way... get out of the    corridors... let them through...
Kira to Ops... Lower Pylon One is    gone... I need emergency...
Sisko to Kira.  Report.  Kira, can    you read me...
Disregard, Commander.  False alarm.     Kira out.
All personnel in Lower Pylon One,    report to the outer ring airlock,    prepare for evacuation...
Please, stay inside... this isn't a    show... you, get out of the way...
Odo, Odo, thank goodness... I'd like    to report two missing persons... a    blonde and a brunette...
Can't you see I'm busy...       Don't scare them...
One minute they were whispering sweet    nothings in my ear, the next minute    the sweet nothings were gone...
Would you get off the street before    you...
I've been looking everywhere for    you...
Don't ever do that to me again...
So, Odo what have you conjured up    during all this?
Me?
I should have guessed - nothing at    all.
I've spent all my time chasing    incarnations of the prophets, long    dead lovers, Gunji jackdaws,    blizzards, trollops...
As I've always said -- a man without    any imagination... come along, my    dears... and I'll show you what a    fertile imagination can do...
Imagination, hmph...       Computer, run a level one personnel    sweep of all pylons...
Requested function will take    approximately three minutes.
Let me out of here!
Get the Nagus on subspace... I want    to talk to him and I mean now!  I'm    not spending another minute in this    cell...
How did you get in there?
How did I get in here?       You put me in here!
I guess I did, didn't I?
No imagination, indeed.
Hey, get your cold beer... get your    cold beer right here... peanuts...    souvenirs... scorecards... can't    tell the players without a    scorecard...
So what are you doing here?
I can't go.  I've got homework to    do.
But you'd rather be at the ballpark.
You don't understand -- if I go to    the holosuite without finishing my    homework, my Dad'll kill me.
Kill you?
Yeah.
You really believe he would... kill    you?
I know he would...
If that's true, why are you still    thinking about going...
I'm trying not to.
But you are wondering if you can get    away with it, aren't you...
Well?
Uh, I didn't understand the    directions... uh... the computer    accidentally erased the instruction    page...
You really expect me to believe    that?
No, I guess not.
I really gotta finish my homework.
Benjamin, I need to see you...
What do you have, Dax?
In the last hour alone, the rupture    has expanded twenty-seven percent...    The rate of expansion is increasing...
Can we gain any time by moving the    station?
If the rift collapses, the implosion    would overtake us almost immediately.
How soon before you're ready, Chief?
I'm installing pulse wave devices    into the torpedoes now, Commander...    six or seven minutes...
The rift's gotten large enough to    pick up on visual scanners...
On screen...
Magnify.
All pylons are secured.  Everyone's    been moved to the habitat ring.
(realizing, with     concern)   You're worried...
(reluctantly paying     her attention)   You bet I am... if this doesn't work,    nothing real or imagined is going to    survive...
Hold me, Julian.
Torpedoes ready, Commander...
Status of shields?
All available power has been    transferred... reading shield strength    at one hundred fifty-eight percent    above normal...
Let's hope it's enough.  Red alert.
Fire.
All systems functioning properly...    torpedo guidance is on nominal    track...
Thirty seconds to coordinates...
Impulse sustainer throttling down...    arming pulse wave initiator...
Torpedo hull temperature dropping...
Activating pulse waves... compression    level at fourteen hundred and    rising...
Twenty seconds...
Compression at twenty-nine hundred,    three thousand,...
... terminal targeting spread    confirmed...
... thirty-five hundred... holding    compression...
Ten seconds...
Ready to detonate...
Ready, sir.
Five seconds...
Now.
Wave intensity from the rift is    dropping... the thoron field boundary    is shrinking... particle energy is    rising...       Wait a minute, what's this...
Wave emissions are fluctuating...    we're not getting a controlled    collapse...
Chief?
(hands flying across     the console)   Dammit... we're picking up an    exothermic reaction pattern... it    may be neutralizing the pulse waves...    stand by...
Our perimeter sensors are picking up    subspace oscillations... what the    hell does that mean...
Proton counts have tripled...
Residual pulse wave activity from    our torpedoes is down to fourteen    percent...
The flux density readings inside the    rupture are off the scale...
Odo to Ops... Ops?
Com circuits are down.  I'm trying    to reroute pathways.  Life support    is normal.
Shields?
A generator is down.  Section Four    is exposed.
Odo to Ops...
There we go...
Constable... check for casualties,    have your deputies move everybody    out of section Four... we have shield    damage...
Acknowledged.
What are we getting from the rift?
Sensors aren't operating.
(going to work on     them)   Stand by.
I can't feel my hands, Julian...
Lie still...
There's an emergency medical kit in    that cabinet there... get it!
I'm sorry...
Ssshh...
I never meant to bother you...
You didn't bother me...
I can't keep my eyes open...
Don't close them... I want you    awake... you have a nasty    concussion...
Can't help it...
Dax!
Sensors are back on line.
The rupture is now a kilometer wide...    over three hundred and forty percent    larger than before...
Is it showing any signs of collapsing?
Wave emissions from the rift are    still fluctuating... I can't make    sense of these readings... Proton    counts are lower than before...       ... Now they're beginning to rise    again.
The pulse waves from our torpedoes    have been completely neutralized...    it's just a matter of time before    the rift starts to expand again...
How much time...
Minutes.
Suggestions.
Run out of ideas, friend?
I have a suggestion.       Maybe I can be of service.
You?
You created me with powers beyond    mortal men... I would be happy to    use them to assist you... for a price.
Miles... ?
I've always wanted a daughter.
Perimeter sensors are reading subspace    oscillations again...
You're telling me you can seal that    rupture out there?
I can turn straw into gold, my    friend... this seems no more    difficult.
Then, do it, dammit!
Will you meet my price?
This is crazy.  You're out of a    fairytale, a storybook.
Will you give her up... to save so    many others...
No... he doesn't have to...
Dax... when did our sensors first    pick up traces of the rupture...
(not certain where     he's going)   You were there, Benjamin... when we    were first trying to figure this    whole thing out...
And if I remember correctly you said    your previous scans hadn't picked up    any anomalies at all...
I thought that whatever was out there    might have been too small for the    scanners to identify...
So you imagined that we might be    dealing with a subspace rupture which    is exactly what it turned out to    be...
That is what I... imagined...
And once you learned about the rift    that destroyed the Hanoli system, we    all imagined that this might be    another one just like it...       Mister O'Brien, drop the shields.
Sir?
There is no rupture.  There is no    threat to this station.  Or this    system.  End red alert and drop the    shields!
Aye, sir.
And believe it, Mister O'Brien...    it's important that you believe it.
Aye, sir.
Are your sensors picking up any    magnetic shock waves, Major?
Yessir, perimeter readings still    show...
(interrupting,     insisting)   No shock waves at all.
(reacts, looks up,     understands)   None at all.
Lieutenant, proton counts?
Normal.
It's gone.
You're going to be fine.
Of course, I am.  I have the best    doctor in the galaxy.
None of this makes any sense... I    mean, why did they appear in the    first place...
It might still be related to the    elevated thoron emissions in the    plasma field... the readings haven't    returned to normal...

Continue your analysis, Dax.  But no    speculations this time.  Just facts.       Major, keep us on yellow alert for    twenty-six hours till we see if    everything's back to normal.  Chief,    take your family home.  That's an    order.
Yes sir.
This... imagination of yours... it's    a tough concept for us to get a handle    on, Ben.
You're not simply a figment of my    imagination, are you...

We're on an extended mission exploring    the galaxy... Awhile back, we followed    one of your ships through that hole    in space out there... we've been    watching you, trying to figure out    the rules of your game...
Why didn't you just talk to us...    like this?
We've learned you never can tell how    someone's going to treat the visiting    team...
I understand...
Well, that's what this has been all    about.  Learning to understand.
Was it really necessary to put the    whole station in jeopardy?

But we didn't, Ben.  You did.  It    was your imaginations that created    everything... we were just watching    to see where it took you.  This...    imagination of yours... we've never    seen anything like it.  It's very    real to all of you... and yet it's    not... at first, it seemed to us to    be a curse, an irritation... that    Odo fellow even called it a waste of    time.
I'd disagree with him.

I know you would.  I've learned that    about you.  That you could have such    an... affection... for someone you've    never met...       I wonder if you appreciate how unique    this imagination of yours really is.
Not always.
We've got to go.
But you haven't told us anything    about your species.
I'd like to.
Maybe next year.
